detailEpisodeInfo.summery: Ending for Ep 7
Ending for Ep 9
Ending for Ep 11
Ending for Ep 01
Ending for Ep 3
Ending for Ep 5

Régiment du Cuisine with the Central Gourmet organization lead by Azami Nakiri continues. The 1st BOUT was won by the Soma and the rebels! To keep the momentum going and secure more wins, the rebels place Kuga, Mimasaka and Megishima as their next cards. Central on the other hand, sends in First seat; Tsukasa, Second seat; Rindo and Fourth seat; Saito. With the best members of both team, 2nd BOUT is bound to throw off some sparks!
Source: crunchyroll

2nd BOUT of the Régiment du Cuisine is between Megishima & Rindo, Mimasaka & Saito and Kuga & Tsukasa! The theme of each team is "Chilli", "Tuna" and "Green Tea". Mimasaka shows off his new skill which he devised from working together in a team. The rebel team unite as one to defeat the new found Totsuki Elite Ten! Their dishes are both ready and judgement begins...!
Source: crunchyroll

The 2nd BOUT between the new and old members of the Elite Ten continues. Both Megishima and Mimasaka lose only by a fraction. Why is Kuga so tenaciously persistent about Tsukasa? What kind of dish will they make using "Green Tea?"  The 2nd BOUT comes to an end! The rebels enjoy a short break but the 3rd seat of the Elite Ten, Momo visits them...
Source: crunchyroll

The Régiment de Cuisine enters the 3rd BOUT! Soma & Saito, Takumi & Eizan and Megumi & Momo are lined up for the next round. The 3 members of the rebels studied under famous chefs in the past and Megumi gets some help from Shinomiya for this round. However, her past experience with him bring back traumatic memories and she is unable to do her best. What made her come back to herself was... shojo comics?!
Source: crunchyroll

Megumi and Momo: Who will win this round of the 3rd BOUT of Régiment du Cuisine!? Meanwhile, Takumi and Eizan prepare their "beef" themed dish. While Takumi works on his version of the traditional Japanese dish "Shigure-ni", Eizan plays dirty behind his back in order to gain an advantage! What is Takumi`s secret plan after being cornered?!
Source: crunchyroll

The Shokugeki between Takumi and Eizan comes to an end and there’s only one pair left! Soma is up against Saito, who overcame Mimasaka’s “Perfect Trace”! What will they cook using the theme of the battle butter?!
Source: crunchyroll

The heated battle enters 4th BOUT! The three remaining Central members are Tsukasa, Rindo, and Momo. With the stakes being the highest they’ve ever been, the rebel team goes all-out with their best, too, with Isshiki, Takumi, and Erina! Erina finally joins the battle and she is up against Momo. The battle neither side can afford to lose is about to begin.
Source: crunchyroll

Azami Nakiri turns up to the battle venue and announces that he will be involved as a judge for this round! The rebels are outraged but even Senzaemon, who is supposed to be on their side, agrees to this change! With everyone confused, Takumi’s and Rindo’s dishes are ready to be served!
Source: crunchyroll

One win for the Central and one win for the rebels! The Shokugeki between Isshiki and Tsukasa reaches its climax! The theme for their round was the classical French ingredient, “rabbit meat”! Isshiki’s dish manages to impress the judges but Tsukasa seemed to be unmoved. Will Tsukasa be able to surpass Isshiki’s super aggressive dish?!
Source: crunchyroll

The last Team Shokugeki begins!
For the FINAL BOUT, each member from the team must complete one appetizer and one main dish to complete a course meal.
Although teamwork is crucial in this battle, Soma and Erina continue to bicker on.
On the other hand, the invincible pair of Tsukasa and Rindo are ready to present their dishes!
Source: crunchyroll

During the FINAL BOUT, Soma challenges Erina to a Shokugeki! There was a hidden motive behind it; Soma wanted Erina to put everything she has into her specialty! As the time limit draws nearer, Erina accepts Soma’s challenge and starts to prepare a new dish! What will Erina present as her specialty?!
Source: crunchyroll

The time has come to decide the winner for the FINAL BOUT! In the end, the rebel team wins the battle! Azami admits the defeat of Central and leaves the venue without a word. However, he is stopped by his old friends Joichiro and Dojima. Meanwhile, Soma and others have gathered to decide who will now sit at the table of the Elite Ten.
Source: crunchyroll

title.text: Behind the Scenes of Food Wars

detailEpisodeInfo.summery:
Crunchyroll takes you behind the scenes of the hit anime, Food Wars ! The Fourth Plate. The team behind the series shows us what it takes to take food from the Shonen Jump manga and make them into full motion animation.
Source: crunchyroll

names.name: Shokugeki no Souma: Shin no Sara
食戟のソーマ 神ノ皿

overviews.content:
http://anidb.net/ch71248 [Yukihira Souma], who has been honing his cooking skills at his family diner "Yukihira" all his life, enters a super elite culinary academy called "Totsuki Saryo Culinary Academy". He improves as a chef through interactions with other chefs in and out of the academy but everything changes when http://anidb.net/ch93338 [Nakiri Azami] has taken over the chief in command position at the academy. With the Central Gourmet Organization ruling over the academy, the students are no longer allowed to cook freely. Souma and friends stood against the regime and as a result, they were labeled as rebels of the Academy!
Season of the Advancement Exams arrive. They managed to pass the exams despite some interference but Cenrral Gourmet Organization will stop at nothing! Finally, some of Souma`s friends lose and are sentenced to be expelled! In order to breakthrough this situation, Souma and the remaining rebels challenge new Council members and Azami regime to Régiment du Cuisine!
The 1st BOUT was won by the rebels with ease but this is only the beginning of the battle to decide their fates. 2nd BOUT is about to begin!
Will Souma and others be able to take the seats at the Council and save their friends!?
Source: Official website

title._text: Shokugeki no Souma: Shin no Sara
食戟のソーマ 神ノ皿

anime._text: Shokugeki no Souma: Gou no Sara
Shokugeki no Souma: San no Sara - Tootsuki Ressha Hen

recommendation._text:
The final confontation with the villain introduced on the third season.

This time full of cooking battles (although i find them still lacking) and rather ridiculous twists towards the end and laughable motivations. I would have preferred more straight battles. Among the best things about this season are the character growth of Nakiri Erina.

This season could perfectly serve as satisfactory ending for most watchers but it seems the show wont end yet for those who still want more. After all Yukihiro Souma still hasn`t gotten what he wanted yet.

Over the past 2 weeks i`ve watched all season up till now. Can`t say i liked the other seasons better than this one nor do i agree with the lower rating. I did like the faster pace of this season and found the battles enjoyable, as were the echi scenes. Also Souma is still one of the best main characters i`ve seen in an anime.

In my opinion the ending was perfect for the Shokugeki no Souma series, hope they don`t drag it out with the next season.

Highly recommended, but only after watching the previous seasons

This concludes the tournament started in the last season, so technically Tootsuki Ressha Hen and Shin no Sara are one season, really. This is 12 episodes of pure tournament cooking with a lot of backstories on the elite 10, which gets a bit predictable, but there`s also some good character development especially towards the very end. 
This would have made quite a nice conclusion, actually.

description._text:
http://anidb.net/ch71248 [Yukihira Souma], who has been honing his cooking skills at his family diner "Yukihira" all his life, enters a super elite culinary academy called "Totsuki Saryo Culinary Academy". He improves as a chef through interactions with other chefs in and out of the academy but everything changes when http://anidb.net/ch93338 [Nakiri Azami] has taken over the chief in command position at the academy. With the Central Gourmet Organization ruling over the academy, the students are no longer allowed to cook freely. Souma and friends stood against the regime and as a result, they were labeled as rebels of the Academy!
Season of the Advancement Exams arrive. They managed to pass the exams despite some interference but Cenrral Gourmet Organization will stop at nothing! Finally, some of Souma`s friends lose and are sentenced to be expelled! In order to breakthrough this situation, Souma and the remaining rebels challenge new Council members and Azami regime to Régiment du Cuisine!
The 1st BOUT was won by the rebels with ease but this is only the beginning of the battle to decide their fates. 2nd BOUT is about to begin!
Will Souma and others be able to take the seats at the Council and save their friends!?
Source: Official website

In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18.
Source: Wikipedia
Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment.
The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility.
If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.
What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime.
It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse.
See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

The Weekly Shounen Jump is a Japanese manga magazine released on a weekly basis. Its main target audience consists of young males and it features several manga titles. The magazine was created by http://anidb.net/cr780 [Shueisha] in July, 1968, and was originally only called Shounen Jump, because it was not published every week at the time. A number of very famous shounen manga were or are published in it, such as http://anidb.net/a386 [Hokuto no Ken], http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], http://anidb.net/a942 [City Hunter], http://anidb.net/a826 [Saint Seiya], http://anidb.net/a590 [Slam Dunk], http://anidb.net/a312 [Yuu Yuu Hakushou], http://anidb.net/a69 [One Piece], http://anidb.net/a239 [Naruto], http://anidb.net/a2369 [Bleach], http://anidb.net/a4563 [Death Note], http://anidb.net/a3468 [Gintama], to name a few of the most well-known.

Isami is a first-year student of the high school division of Toutsuki Tea Ceremony and Cooking Academy. He`s http://anidb.net/ch72122 [Takumi]`s younger twin brother. He has worked in a professional culinary setting from a very young age. He moved to Japan to transfer into the academy with his brother. Laid-back and generous in nature, he sometimes makes fun of his brother.
Source: Official Website

Jouichirou is http://anidb.net/ch71248 [Souma]`s father. The former owner of the neighbourhood diner Yukihira, he suddenly closed shop and decided to travel around the world as a chef.
Source: Official Website

Second-year student, High School Division, Totsuki Saryo Culinary Academy.
9th Seat, Totsuki Elite Ten
Ever since the Mozuya incident, he has harbored animosity toward Soma. An expert food consultant, he has handled numerous clients since junior high school times. His culinary skills are yet unknown.
Source: Official Page
